descript.abstract: These data represent beaches in Grenada and St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG). Polygons for the country of Grenada were digitized from WorldView2 2010 orthophotos. SVG polygons were digitzed from 2007 aerial photos. Digitization was limited to the 10 meter elevation contour.
descript.purpose: These data were created under the direction of The Nature Conservancy for the Ecosystem Based Adaptation in the Grenadine Bank project. This project is built on the hypothesis that the neighboring and ecologically connected small island states in the Grenadine Bank can enhance the resilience of people and nature to climate change impacts by protecting, restoring and sustainably managing marine and coastal systems and strengthening community capacity for adaptation.

idinfo.datacred: Completed 15 March 2012. Digitized by Teresa Gomez and Ryan Flake of BYU under contract by the Nature Conservancy. Contact Conservation Information Manager, caribgis@tnc.org.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.3.3600

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Designates a type to each feature. Specifies whether the feature is a regular beach, a black sand beach, a white sand beach or a rocky beach.
Source of where feature was digitized or pulled from

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
